alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas through 845 PM CDT... At 811 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of St. Francis, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Wheeler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
